forecast.name: Today
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly sunny, with a high near 27. Southwest wind 5 to 9 mph.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Snow likely between 7pm and 4am. Mostly cloudy. Low around 27, with temperatures rising to around 34 overnight. Southwest wind 6 to 9 mph. Chance of precipitation is 60%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
This morning in Boston, a delicate tranquility envelops the landscape, as the sun peeks over the horizon, casting a soft glow onto the city. The air is crisp, with temperatures gently hovering around a refreshing 27 degrees, a precursor to what promises to be a day of contrasts. The sky is mostly sunny now, but whispers of an impending change are already evident; clouds gather quietly on the western edge, ready to usher in a shift come evening. As the day unfolds, expect the warmth of the sun to reach a pleasant peak near 27 degrees, complemented by a gentle southwest breeze that carries a freshness through the streets and parks.

As the sun sets, however, the clouds will thicken, signaling a likely snowfall between the hours of dusk and the early morning hush. With a 60% chance of precipitation, those seeking outdoor adventures might do well to take advantage of the daylight hours, perhaps wandering through local coffee shops or perusing the bookstores that dot the neighborhood. Subtle layers will serve you well: a soft scarf and a warm coat will keep the chill at bay today, while later, the promise of snow might summon thoughts of cozy evenings by the window, watching the world transform into a canvas of white. In this fleeting interlude before the storm, there is both beauty and comfort to be found, where the rhythm of a typical winter day lingers gently in the air.
